intro: Pentanura sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran pentanura, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming during the rainy season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
